groups.name: Compassionate PDX
groups.description: "Compassionate PDX is a grass-roots group of volunteers dedicated to creating political change in favor of non-human animals. Our local chapter is affilliated with Compassionate Cities, along with several other cities including Berkeley, San Diego, and Toronto."

groups.name: Try Vegan PDX
groups.description: "Try Vegan PDX offers education and resources, events and support, and activism opportunities in Portland, Oregon and beyond. We champion for the animals, those interested in a compassionate lifestyle, and the larger vegan community."

groups.name: Voices for the Animals
groups.description: "Voices for the Animals is a monthly half hour  program that tackles the issues around animal rights, with interviews of front-line activists who are working to make a difference in the lives of animals around the world. With hosts Noah Bristol, Julianne Schwartz, and Michele Coppola."

groups.name: Animal Rights March PNW
groups.description: "The Official Animal Rights March is an annual vegan march founded by Surge in 2016. The purpose of the march is to unite the vegan community globally and to inspire vegans to speak up for animals in their everyday lives and to get active in their local communities."

groups.name: Food Not Bombs PDX
groups.description: "Mission: To help build a stronger, healthier, community by working together creatively, without hierarchy or violence to meet the nutritive needs shared by every person on earth."

groups.name: Sea Shepherd Portland
groups.description: "Welcome to the Portland Chapter of Sea Shepherd Conservation Society! We are a newly formed chapter in the state of Oregon. We are excited about supporting our crews and campaigns, as well as taking on some of the many issues that need to be tackled here in the Pacific Northwest!"

groups.name: UU Animal Ministry PDX
groups.description: "Our Mission is to promote understanding and awareness of Animals as fellow Sentient Beings in line with the 7th UU Principle, and to provide Animal Advocacy Ministry, Education, and Support to our  Members and the Church Community as a whole."

groups.name: Wildwood Farm Sanctuary
groups.description: "Located on 98 acres in Newberg Oregon, Wildwood Farm Sanctuary is a haven for farm animals and wildlife alike. We provide lifelong refuge and rehabilitation for abused and abandoned farm animals while lovingly protecting the property's native plants, wetlands, woodlands, and wild animals."
groups.address: 15481 NE North Valley Rd, Newberg, OR 97132

groups.name: Veganville Animal Sanctuary
groups.description: "Veganville allows volunteers and visitors to help out with projects and  get introduced to our rescued animals as an opportunity to learn about the modern day agribusiness and its effects on the animals, our health as humans and the impact on our environment."

groups.name: Portland Vegans
groups.description: "Portland Vegans is a community of individuals from different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives based in Portland, Oregon. Whether you've been vegan for a very long time, or you are interested in the vegan lifestyle, all are welcome!"

groups.name: Vegans of Portland
groups.description: "This group is intended to serve the vegan community in Portland by providing a space for open, respectful discussion about all subjects that affect our lives, including but not limited to veganism and animal rights."

groups.name: Soyboys Vegan Men's Group
groups.description: "Soyboys is a local group of vegan gay men who host dine-outs and attend special events throughout the city. We love visiting the best vegan and veg-friendly spots around the city."

groups.name: Green Acres Farm Sanctuary
groups.description: "The mission of Green Acres Farm Sanctuary is the prevention of cruelty to, and the commercialization of animals, especially farmed animals. We put this mission into action by providing shelter, care and board to abused, abandoned, and unwanted farm animals. We look to inspire change through creating a place where members of the public can have positive interaction with farm animals by providing for their care and the animals can, in turn, educate them about the abusive use of farmed animals."
groups.address: 5272 Brush Creek Dr NE, Silverton, OR 97381

groups.name: Humane Voters Oregon
groups.description: "Humane Voters Oregon is a non-partisan organization that promotes humane treatment of animals through participation in Oregon’s political process."
groups.address: 5331 SW Macadam Ave., Suite 258 (PMB 624), Portland, OR 97202

groups.name: Lighthouse Farm Sanctuary
groups.description: "Lighthouse Farm Sanctuary is a 501(c)(3) organization dedicated to the rescue, rehabilitation and, when appropriate, rehoming of abused and neglected farmed animals."

groups.name: Northwest VEG
groups.description: "Northwest VEG is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization based in the Portland, OR and Vancouver, WA area. Founded in 2003, we are dedicated to bringing awareness to the power of a plant-based, vegan lifestyle and helping support people in their transition toward making healthier, more sustainable & compassionate food choices."

groups.name: Northwest Veg's Viva La Vegan - Portland Metro
groups.description: "This group seeks to bring together those interested in or currently living a compassionate vegan lifestyle for enjoyment and activities."

groups.name: NW Animal Foundation
groups.description: "The NW Animal Foundation, a recognized 501 (c)(3) based in Portland, Oregon, is an organization that raises funds to support animal rescues, sanctuaries and other organizations that address or prevent abuse."

groups.name: Odd Man Inn Animal Refuge
groups.description: "Odd Man Inn helps as many animals as possible find safety, rehabilitation, socialization and a forever home while giving them a voice as ambassadors for their own kind against imprisonment, abuse and consumption."

groups.name: Out To Pasture Sanctuary
groups.description: "Out to Pasture Sanctuary is a farmed animal sanctuary located in Estacada, Oregon. We provide a loving, permanent home to animals rescued from abuse, neglect, and slaughter, including farmed animals, animals rescued from scientific laboratories, and others."
groups.address: 33190 SE Regan Hill Rd, Estacada, OR 97023

groups.name: PDX VEG
groups.description: "PDX VEG seeks to empower people to shift towards a way of life that benefits humans, other animals, and our planet by providing three-week Veg Challenges that include cooking demos, a Vegan Mentor Program, practical tips, inspiration, and community, all free of charge."

groups.name: PEACE Portland
groups.description: "We are PEACE! We stand for the Promotion of Equality, Acceptance, and Compassion Everywhere (PEACE). We are a love-based group of humanitarians focused on liberating all beings from slavery, exploitation and cruelty."

groups.name: Portland Animal Save
groups.description: "Portland Animal Save bears witness to animals killed for food and clothing using a love-based community organizing approach."

groups.name: Portland Burrito Brigade
groups.description: "Burrito Brigade is a non-profit 501c(3) organization whose mission is to feed the hungry and unhoused in Oregon by hand-delivering vegan meals for free."

groups.name: Portland Metro Veggies
groups.description: "This Meetup is for vegans, vegetarians and the veg-curious. We come from all over the greater Portland metro area, East, West, North and South."

groups.name: AV: Portland, OR, USA
groups.description: "Anonymous for the Voiceless (AV) is an animal rights organization that specializes in educating the public on animal exploitation and fostering highly effective activism groups worldwide. We hold an abolitionist stance against animal exploitation and promote a clear vegan message."

groups.name: AV: Vancouver, WA, USA
groups.description: "Anonymous for the Voiceless (AV) is an animal rights organization that specializes in educating the public on animal exploitation and fostering highly effective activism groups worldwide. We hold an abolitionist stance against animal exploitation and promote a clear vegan message."

groups.name: Direct Action Everywhere - Portland
groups.description: "Direct Action Everywhere's mission is to empower activists to take strong and confident action wherever animals are being denigrated, enslaved, or killed, and create a world where animal liberation is a reality. We use creative nonviolent protest to tell the animals’ story."

groups.name: Advocates for Animal Welfare
groups.description: "We help connect people who want to get involved in, or learn more about, animal welfare issues. We welcome people from all places on the spectrum - from people who just really love dogs to people who believe in total liberation for animals."

groups.name: PAW Team
groups.description: "The Portland Animal Welfare (PAW) Team saves lives, alleviates suffering, and keeps pets and people together by providing free veterinary care to the pets of people who are experiencing homelessness or extreme poverty."

groups.name: The Raven Corps
groups.description: "The Raven Corps is a tax-exempt nonprofit organization, based out of Portland, Oregon. We support, organize, and mobilize young activists, aged 14 -22, who promote environmental sustainability and compassion through plant-based advocacy."
